https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.short_instructions: Drag the [blockly block][0] block into the workspace, and connect it inside the [blockly block][1] block.
https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.long_instructions:
Drag the [blockly block][0] block into the workspace, and connect it inside the [blockly block][1]
 block. 

 Choose `cat` or `sloth` to create your first dancer.

-   _You can also click the lightbulb to the left if you want more information or extra challenges._

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   Make sure a dancer appears on the screen.

_This level ends after 4 measures._
authored_hints.challenges:
**Optional Challenges**

-   Choose a different song to play.
-   Move your dancer to a new location.
-   Make more than one dancer.

callouts.dance_callout_01: Choose the type of dancer here.

https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.short_instructions: Make the cat do a dance move when you press a key.
https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.long_instructions:
The [blockly block][0] block lets you run code when you press the arrow buttons. 
Use the [blockly block][1] block to make the cat clap!

_Make sure to press your "up arrow" key or [][2] after clicking the Run button!_

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   The dancer must perform a move.
-   You must press an arrow key.

_This level ends after 4 measures._
authored_hints.challenges:
**Optional Challenge**

Use more than one [blockly block][0] block.

callouts.dance_callout_11_a: Add this block to your program.
callouts.arrow_buttons: Press the arrow buttons to control your dancer.

https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.short_instructions: It's time for a dance-off! Program each dancer to move when you press different keys. Choose your favorite move for each dancer or set it to "(Random)" for something totally unpredictable!
https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.long_instructions: It's time for a dance-off! Program each dancer to move when you press different keys. Choose your favorite move for each dancer or set it to `(Random)` for something totally unpredictable!

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   Both dancers must perform a move.
-   You must press the arrow keys.

_This level ends after 6 measures._
authored_hints.challenges:
**Optional Challenge**

-   Make a dancer respond to the left and right arrow keys.

https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.short_instructions: Make your dancer start a new move after the fourth measure.
https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.long_instructions:
Let's get the dancers moving in time with the music!

Connect the [blockly block][0] block to a [blockly block][1] block from the toolbox. 

Your dancer should start a new move after the fourth measure.

**Measures** are used to count time in music. In this tutorial, a measure is four beats long.

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   The dancer needs to switch to a new move after 4 measures.

_The level ends after 7 measures._

callouts.dance_callout_02: Add this block to your program!

https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.short_instructions: Now make the dancer start a new move after 6 measures!
https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.long_instructions:
_Now we're grooving!_ 

Add an [blockly block][0] block to your workspace. Make the dancer start a new move after 6 measures.

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   After 6 measures, your dancer needs to be doing a different dance than it was after 4 measures.

_The level ends after 11 measures._
authored_hints.challenges:
**Optional Challenge**

-   Change the background whenever the dancers switch moves.

callouts.dance_callout_05: Add a new event to your program.

https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.short_instructions: Set up a group of backup dancers around the lead dancer in the middle.
https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.long_instructions:
Use this new block to set up a group of smaller backup dancers around a lead dancer in the middle. 

  [blockly block][0]

Now you can create a bunch of backup dancers all at once!

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   Create one lead dancer and a group of backup dancers within the first 4 measures of the song.

_This level ends after 7 measures._
authored_hints.challenges:
**Optional Challenge**

-   Create multiple groups of backup dancers.

https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.short_instructions: Change the size of the group of backup dancers.
https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.long_instructions:
Every dancer has a set of _properties_ that controls what it looks like.

Use [blockly block][0] under a green event block to make dancers appear closer or farther away.

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   Change the size of at least one dancer.

_This level ends after 6 measures._
authored_hints.challenges:
**Optional Challenge**

-   Experiment by changing other properties such as width or rotation.

https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.short_instructions: Try changing the tint of one of your dancers (or an entire group)!
https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.long_instructions: Dancers have a "tint" property that can add a layer of color. Try changing the tint of one of your dancers (or an entire group)!

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   Change the tint of at least one dancer.

_This level ends after 6 measures._
authored_hints.tint_hint: Did you notice that your dancers don't change to the exact color you choose? This is because **tints** mix the color you choose with the colors of the dancer.

https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.short_instructions: Be creative with these new blocks!
https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.long_instructions:
This **new block** is a special kind of event that is triggered over and over.

[blockly block][0]

By placing the other new blocks in your toolbox inside the repeat block you can repeatedly change dancers' properties over time. Be creative and have fun!

_When you are done press the Finish button._

authored_hints.validation:
**How do I pass this level?**

-   Just press the "Finish" button!
authored_hints.repeat_every_ideas:
**Need some ideas?**

-   Repeatedly change a dancer's size to make it grow.
-   Repeatedly change a dancer's rotation to make it spin.

_You can also use negative numbers to create an opposite effect!_
authored_hints.next_previous:
**Optional Challenge**

-   You can also use this new event block to cycle through a list of dance moves by setting the move to `(Random)`, `(Next)`, or `(Previous)`.
    <xml><block type="Dancelab_changeMoveEachLR">
    <title name="GROUP">???</title>
    <title name="MOVE">"rand"</title>
    <title name="DIR">-1</title>
    </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.short_instructions: Get your groove on! Create a dance of your own to share with your friends.
https://studio.code.org/s/dance-2019/les.long_instructions: Get your groove on! Create a dance of your own to share with your friends.
